<ce:section-title id="st015">Synthesis of the complexes</ce:section-title><ce:section-title id="st020">{[Cd(2-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(μ<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-hmt)(OH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)]·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">To the synthesized Cd(2-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.651<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g,1.35<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) dissolved in 40<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml hot water, hmt (0.189<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1.35<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) dissolved in 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml water was added with constant stirring. The solution was then filtered and left at room temperature and after a few days colorless crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> suitable for X-ray determination was collected from the solution.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st025">[Cd(3-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(hmt)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(OH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]·2(3-nbzH) (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0180" view="all">To 3-nitrobenzoic acid (0.836<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) dissolved in 50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml hot water, cadmium carbonate (0.517<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was added pinch by pinch. The mixture was stirred till effervescence ceased. The solution was then filtered, the volume of filtrate was reduced to ca.25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml by warming in a water bath and then hmt (0.560<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) dissolved in 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml water was added with constant stirring. The solution was left at room temperature and after a few days colorless crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> suitable for X-ray determination were collected from the solution.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st030">[Cd(3-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(μ<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-hmt)]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0185" view="all">Complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was synthesized following the same procedure as that of complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> except that synthesized Cd(3-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O was used instead of Cd(2-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O.</ce:para><ce:para id="p0050" view="all">Yield: 0.540<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (47%). <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>CdN<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf> (584.82): C, 41.07; H, 3.45; N, 14.37; . Found: C, 41.11; H, 3.51; N, 14.30%. Selected IR peaks (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 1600, 1549, 1530, 1399, 1346, 992 and 833.</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st035">{[Cd<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(4-nbz)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(μ<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>-hmt)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(OH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]·H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0055" view="all">To 4-nitrobenzoic acid (0.836<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) dissolved in 70<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml hot water, cadmium carbonate (1.724<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was added pinch by pinch. The mixture was stirred till effervescence ceased. The solution was then filtered, the volume of filtrate was reduced to ca. 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml by warming in a water bath and then hmt (0.560<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) dissolved in 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml water was added with constant stirring. The solution was left at room temperature and after a few days colorless crystals of <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> suitable for X-ray determination were collected from the solution. Yield: 0.325<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (47%). <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">25</ce:inf>CdN<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">10.5</ce:inf> (629.86): C, 38.14; H, 4.00; N, 13.34; . Found: C, 38.21; H, 4.03; N, 13.42%. Selected IR peaks (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3396, 3058, 1587, 1535, 1391, 1343, 999 and 806.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of the complexes

{[Cd(2-nbz)2(μ2-hmt)(OH2)]⋅2H2O} n  (1)

To the synthesized Cd(2-nbz)2⋅2H2O (0.651g,1.35mmol) dissolved in 40ml hot water, hmt (0.189g, 1.35mmol) dissolved in 10ml water was added with constant stirring. The solution was then filtered and left at room temperature and after a few days colorless crystals of 1 suitable for X-ray determination was collected from the solution.

[Cd(3-nbz)2(hmt)2(OH2)2]⋅2(3-nbzH) (2)

To 3-nitrobenzoic acid (0.836g, 5mmol) dissolved in 50ml hot water, cadmium carbonate (0.517g, 3mmol) was added pinch by pinch. The mixture was stirred till effervescence ceased. The solution was then filtered, the volume of filtrate was reduced to ca.25ml by warming in a water bath and then hmt (0.560g, 4mmol) dissolved in 10ml water was added with constant stirring. The solution was left at room temperature and after a few days colorless crystals of 2 suitable for X-ray determination were collected from the solution.

[Cd(3-nbz)4(μ2-hmt)] n  (3)

Complex 3 was synthesized following the same procedure as that of complex 1 except that synthesized Cd(3-nbz)22H2O was used instead of Cd(2-nbz)22H2O.

Yield: 0.540g (47%). Anal. Calc. for C20H20CdN6O8 (584.82): C, 41.07; H, 3.45; N, 14.37; . Found: C, 41.11; H, 3.51; N, 14.30%. Selected IR peaks (cm-1): 1600, 1549, 1530, 1399, 1346, 992 and 833.

{[Cd2(4-nbz)4(μ2-hmt)2(OH2)2]⋅H2O} n  (4)

To 4-nitrobenzoic acid (0.836g, 5mmol) dissolved in 70ml hot water, cadmium carbonate (1.724g, 10mmol) was added pinch by pinch. The mixture was stirred till effervescence ceased. The solution was then filtered, the volume of filtrate was reduced to ca. 20ml by warming in a water bath and then hmt (0.560g, 4mmol) dissolved in 10ml water was added with constant stirring. The solution was left at room temperature and after a few days colorless crystals of 4 suitable for X-ray determination were collected from the solution. Yield: 0.325g (47%). Anal. Calc. for C20H25CdN6O10.5 (629.86): C, 38.14; H, 4.00; N, 13.34; . Found: C, 38.21; H, 4.03; N, 13.42%. Selected IR peaks (cm-1): 3396, 3058, 1587, 1535, 1391, 1343, 999 and 806.
